info.title: Swagger Petstore - OpenAPI 3.0
info.description:
This is a sample Pet Store Server based on the OpenAPI 3.0 specification.  You can find out more about
Swagger at [https://swagger.io](https://swagger.io). In the third iteration of the pet store, we've switched to the design first approach!
You can now help us improve the API whether it's by making changes to the definition itself or to the code.
That way, with time, we can improve the API in general, and expose some of the new features in OAS3.

Some useful links:
- [The Pet Store repository](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore)
- [The source API definition for the Pet Store](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore/blob/master/src/main/resources/openapi.yaml)

put.description: Update an existing pet by Id.

requestBody.description: Update an existent pet in the store

post.summary: Add a new pet to the store.
post.description: Add a new pet to the store.

requestBody.description: Create a new pet in the store

get.description: Multiple status values can be provided with comma separated strings.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

get.description: Multiple tags can be provided with comma separated strings. Use tag1, tag2, tag3 for testing.

post.summary: Updates a pet in the store with form data.
post.description: Updates a pet resource based on the form data.

parameter.name: petId
parameter.description: ID of pet that needs to be updated

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Name of pet that needs to be updated

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Status of pet that needs to be updated

get.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities.

post.summary: Place an order for a pet.
post.description: Place a new order in the store.

get.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value <= 5 or > 10. Other values will generate exceptions.

parameter.name: orderId
parameter.description: ID of order that needs to be fetched

delete.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value < 1000. Anything above 1000 or non-integers will generate API errors.

parameter.name: orderId
parameter.description: ID of the order that needs to be deleted

post.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

post.summary: Creates list of users with given input array.
post.description: Creates list of users with given input array.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password for login in clear text

header.description: calls per hour allowed by the user
date in UTC when token expires

get.summary: Logs out current logged in user session.
get.description: Log user out of the system.
Get user detail based on username.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The name that needs to be fetched. Use user1 for testing

put.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: name that need to be deleted

requestBody.description: Update an existent user in the store

delete.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The name that needs to be deleted

requestBody.description: Pet object that needs to be added to the store
